intro: Cissus leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruit cissus, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by distinctive, fleshy, white berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its unique fruit and foliage make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
